title: Bard Clarifications
body:
A new champion has been released (Wooo!). The boards are already flooded with complaints of how he will be op, or how he will be a troll pick. 

I think speculation/complaints on how broken a champion is going to be are not very productive. That being said, I would like to be able to think about how he might be able to be played. I always have fun doing that with new champs. 

I have a few questions of how some of is abilities work. I realize I could wait until he hits PBE, but I thought I'd ask now anyway.

Passive:
It was stated in the comments that chimes are semi-random spawning. Can we see them through the fog, or do we have to randomly stroll upon them? 

Q:
Looks awesome, can't wait.

W:
I feel like to get an understanding of this, knowing its cooldown/how long they last would be pretty important. Do i have to sit in lane for 3 min to give my adc enough of these to feel comfortable roaming?  Also, can  I use these, or are they just for allied champions? I feel like this is a really important distinction in enabling him to be played anywhere but as a support. 

E:
Cool ability, this is one I think I will have to wait and see to get a feel for it..

R:
If someone is already zhona's'd when this goes off, does the zhona's prevent the R or does the R persist past the zhonas?

if anyone else has any quirky interactions that they are curious about with this guy, I'd like to hear them for my own curiosity. 

Can't wait to get a chance to play around with this guy. Looks like a lot of fun.

replies.body:
As the Bard player you'll see Chimes on your minimap when they spawn, regardless of whether they're in fog of war or not.

W has a CD of 12s, you can have a maximum of 3 on the ground at once and they currently last until consumed by an ally or stomped by an enemy.

Bard's ult doesn't hit units that are already untargetable (so you can dodge it with Zhonya's, Fizz E, Elise E etc).
What is the maximum length of a bard portal? Is it uncapped, meaning a well-placed portal could potentially wormhole your team across vast distances?
Uncapped, though will stop once it runs out of terrain to go through. You can get some pretty long Magical Journeys going, speed of travel does slow down a bit on longer ones though.

Having been messing around on the PBE, I'm actually tempted to say that this isn't wholly true on maps other than Summoner's rift. There are places in both twisted Treeline and Howling abyss where, were this actually the case, I would expect to be able to create a portal. On howling abyss I expect it's a case of the walls not actually being there (the holes in the bridge, I imagine, curve inward and aren't actually walls other than right next to the bridge), but on twisted treeline, the giant wall that separates the jungle and the base has a spot where it LOOKS like you should be able to portal through, but you can't. The break is close to the center of the wall itself, I believe. And in the case of there not being a break, well...

Guess that means there's an unintended cap?

I didn't think about it, but yeah, wouldn't Bard's portal be pretty useless on HA?

Heavily situational, yes, but not useless. There've been times when I was able to portal from one bush into the other at the center and take the enemy by surprise. Additionally, you  can tunnel from the base to the outer turrets and back if you aim in properly.

Thanks so much for the response!  He looks like a fantastic champion. 

One more question for now:

Will he be able to use his own shrines? I assume based on the phrasing of "consumed by an *ally*" that he will not be able to use the shrines. But that difference seems to be the only mechanical constraint from him being able to be played successfully in a non-support position.
Bard can use his own Shrines.

Since this is a Bard thread, I find it fitting to ask; did you check to make sure his portal ability doesn't have a panic attack and glitch out when used on a temporary wall?

Last thing I want to do is accidentally crash a game because a portal lasted longer than Anivia's wall.

It currently doesn't interact with temporary terrain at all (though his Q does). That's something we might change at some point, still debating whether it's sufficiently valuable gameplay to be worth the coding time though versus other stuff we could work on instead.

http://st.elohell.net/public/chill/0fa2d73ba2e21779aeb1d784b35262cf.jpg

Haha, but I see what you're saying.

I feel like there could be room for like...say...Gnar top, Anivia mid, Bard support to make some really strange plays around/through her wall. Would be highly situational that you'd need to go through the wall to make the play though.
Example: Anivia and Bard running from 3+ enemies. Anivia walls to keep them away a bit longer, Gnar hops in already in hulk form (so he doesn't get the double hop.) Enemy now has a second to decide to continue chasing. Gnar on wrong side of the wall to get the knockback off, wall will fade or enemies will get away from the wall before he can get to them to use ulti. Bard sends Gnar on a Magical Journey to the other side, wall slams, wall fades, people get rekt.
Yeh, highly unlikely situation. But it'd be awesome to see =D

Do the Chime locations have any weighted values to them? I.e., are they *more* likely to spawn in certain locations (in lane, in jungle, in river), or even on your side of the map rather than the opposing side, or is it one big free for all? While I think its interesting to see an RNG-esque function in a champ when it has largely been moved away from, I'm always game for an interesting concept.

Also, can the enemy players see or interact with the Chimes in any way?

They're more likely to spawn near Bard, early game especially. 

Other players, whether ally or enemy, can see Chimes, but can't interact with them at all.

Gotcha, thank you for your response Meddler. I'm excited to see what people do with Bard. I've been waiting for LoL to use an AoE Stasis ult for a while, and you actually stepped it up with the inclusion of monsters & turrets! Nicely done. :)

Now if I can just convince Lyte to look into my [other ideas](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/ZEePP9xK-proposal-post-game-badges-or-accomplishments-for-positive-player-feedback) then I'll be *really* excited.

Also happy to hear that Bard can use his own shrines. That should pigeonhole him less and maybe we'll see some unique comps with him.
can you tell us how you have contributed to the Bard project?
